definition[0]: to suggest that someone or something is the cause of a particular situation, or is responsible for a particular action, especially something bad
example[0]: The court ruled that the newspaper report did impute a criminal offense.
definition[1]: to calculate the value of something which cannot easily be measured in the usual way by giving it a value based on similar things
example[1]: The Inland Revenue imputes a set amount of taxable income according to the size of a company carâ€™s engine.
example[2]: CableWest imputes to its costs an amount for connection to its exchange.
definition[2]: if the interest on a loan is imputed to the loan agreement, the interest is calculated at market rates, even though the actual rate of interest paid may be lower than the market rates
